attributes.action: Create a governing body for sport throwing of knives and axes.
attributes.additional_details: There are a great many individuals in the UK and worldwide who take part in knife and axe throwing, if new legislation is brought in regarding the carrying of knives, there should also be amendments/legislation regarding the carriage of knives for sport purposes, possibly with the assistance of local police/local authorities to avoid people being arrested for carrying knives/axes for sport purposes with no criminal intent.
attributes.background: As a member of the UK Knife, Axe and Tomahawk Throwing Association (KATTA), and with the ongoing debates regarding knofe crime, I believe it is essential to set up some sort of governing body/local authority regarding the carriage of knives and axes solely for use in the sport of throwing at a club.

rejection.details:
It's not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament to create a governing body for a sport.

You could start a new petition calling for an action that is the UK Government's or Parliament's responsibility. 

You can find out more about current laws on possesion of offensive weapons, knives, bladed and pointed articles here:

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles
